title: A356 Aluminum Alloy Prices Fell on Feb 9
summary: SMM reported that the price of A356 aluminum alloy dipped 200 yuan/mt on February 9. This decline reflects ongoing market pressures in the aluminum alloy sector ahead of the holiday festival.

title: Aluminum Ingot Inventory Buildup Pressure Rises, Aluminum Prices Mainly Under Pressure [SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Aluminum ingot inventories are building up, exerting downward pressure on aluminum prices. The SMM morning meeting highlights ongoing market challenges in the aluminum sector.

title: Holiday Atmosphere Intensifies Before the Festival, Secondary Aluminum Market in the Doldrums [SMM Cast Aluminum Alloy Morning Comment]
summary: The secondary aluminum market remains sluggish amid intensifying holiday atmosphere before the festival. SMM notes doldrums in cast aluminum alloy trading and pricing.

title: Century's Hawesville smelter sale in the context of US primary aluminum
summary: Century Aluminum's sale of its idled Hawesville, Kentucky smelter marks a significant milestone for the US primary aluminum industry. The company planned a $50 million investment to restart 90 remaining pots, targeting capacity of over 220,000 metric tons per year by June 30, which would add approximately 10% to US primary aluminum production. The article also discusses the broader context of US aluminum capacity, noting that even with all remaining smelters at full capacity, the country remains dependent on imports for the majority of its primary aluminum needs.

title: LME aluminium prices record cash offer rising to $3,045/t while inventories slide downwards
summary: Aluminum prices on the London Metal Exchange rose sharply on February 6, with both cash and forward contracts reporting gains. The LME aluminum opening stocks declined to 490,975 tonnes on February 6 from 492,975 tonnes on February 5, marking a 0.4% decrease, while cancelled warrants dropped sharply by 3.82%.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum rose to 3,111.65 USD/T on February 6, 2026, up 2.52% from the previous day, with prices up 17.97% compared to the same time last year. The commodity is expected to trade at 3,134.12 USD/Tonne by the end of the current period, reflecting continued strength in the aluminum market.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball Corporation and Unilever have produced the first consumer goods packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminium smelting technology from Alcoa and Rio Tinto. The aerosol cans combine 50% ELYSIS aluminium with 50% post-consumer recycled content, advancing sustainable packaging by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through inert anode technology that produces oxygen instead of CO2. This collaboration highlights innovations in low-carbon primary aluminium and higher recycled content for decarbonizing the aluminium sector.

title: Nagoya University Researchers Develop Aluminum Alloys for Metal 3D Printing
summary: Researchers from Nagoya University developed a new family of heat-resistant, recyclable aluminum alloys (Al-Fe-Mn-Ti) optimized for metal 3D printing processes like laser powder bed fusion. These alloys maintain strength at high temperatures, addressing limitations of traditional aluminum in applications like turbines and engines, while using low-cost elements for recyclability and circular economy benefits. The innovation enables lightweight, high-performance components in automotive, aeronautics, and energy sectors.

title: ESG Leaders Recognized At 2026 SEAL Business Sustainability Awards
summary: Pillumina received the SEAL Sustainable Product Award for replacing single-use plastic prescription bottles with infinitely recyclable aluminum solutions that integrate into existing pharmacy workflows. This innovation reduces plastic waste while maintaining performance and safety, supporting long-term sustainability goals in pharmaceuticals. The awards highlight game-changing ideas for a more sustainable future.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Giving Voice and Vision to an Industry in Motion
summary: ALUMINIUM 2026 launches Innovation Awards in categories including Sustainable & Low-Carbon Manufacturing, recognizing aluminium innovations that reduce environmental impact. The event features a Sustainability & Recycling Conference and exhibitors like Speira showcasing digital product passports for coils to enable circular economy transparency. Sustainability is central, with special zones for low-carbon production and recycling advancements.

title: Nucor Raises HRC CSP Steel Price to Kick Off February 2026
summary: Nucor has increased its CSP hot rolled coil (HRC) base price to $970/ton effective the week of February 2, 2026, signaling stronger domestic pricing amid slowing global steel production and sharply reduced U.S. carbon steel imports. Global crude steel output fell 3.7% year-over-year in December 2025, with China experiencing double-digit declines, creating a supply-constrained environment. The price hike reflects reduced external pressure and supports firmer spot negotiations, though vulnerability to demand weakness persists.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel prices fell slightly to 973.09 USD/T on February 9, 2026, down 0.40% from the previous day, after rising to 977 USD/T on February 6. Over the past month, prices have increased 3.74%, with forecasts projecting 990.10 USD/T by quarter-end and 1070.89 USD/T in 12 months. Recent news highlights a 36-week high of 941 USD/T on January 28, 2026.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices dropped to 3,055 CNY/T on February 6, 2026, down 0.81%, with rebar futures hitting a one-month low due to Chinese mills trimming production ahead of Lunar New Year. Blast furnace utilization stayed above 86%, but hot metal output rose slightly week-on-week. Over the past month, prices fell 3.26%, pulling back from five-month highs amid reconsidered speculative trades.

title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Market Update
summary: Steel prices continue rising at domestic mills with extended lead times, alongside tight aluminum supply and lean inventory levels across the supply chain. Energy costs and winter weather are impacting production, affecting metal roofing contractors bidding on Q1 and Q2 projects. The update advises protecting projects and margins amid pricing volatility.

title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update - YouTube
summary: This video update discusses rising steel mill prices, extended lead times, and impacts from energy costs and winter weather on production. It covers tight aluminum supply at four-year highs and lean inventories, offering advice for contractors on managing long-lead projects and pricing risks in Q1 and Q2.

title: Electricity fees 'too high' in UK steel production
summary: UK steel firms will continue to pay 25% more for electricity than European rivals despite government intervention. Trade body UK Steel states this disparity will add £26m to members' bills compared to France. Ministers maintain a bright future for UK steel-making.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 973.09 USD/T on February 9, 2026, down 0.40% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.74%, with recent news noting HRC Steel hitting a 23-month high of 970 USD/T as of January 28, 2026. Year-over-year, prices are up significantly.

title: Day: 7 February 2026 - EUROMETAL
summary: ArcelorMittal's Q4 2025 steel shipments fell 4% to 13 million tonnes, with production down 9% to 12.8 million tonnes. Global apparent steel demand excluding China is forecast to rebound 2% in 2026, with production and shipments increasing across regions. New capacity like the 1mt/y Gijon EAF is set to come online in 2026.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is rebounding with innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap steel, reducing reliance on coal and cutting emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are advancing coal-free processes using renewable energy and chemical reactions, making production more energy-efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even Chinese production. These technologies promise full decarbonization, offsetting potential rises in emissions amid weakening federal protections.

title: Bearings of Change: SKF's roadmap for efficient motion
summary: SKF Industrial’s bearing innovations emphasize sustainability through advanced materials like corrosion-resistant coatings, lightweight composites, and hybrid ceramic bearings, extending service life and reducing raw material needs. These solutions have driven up to 25% lower carbon emissions, significant grease savings, and longer maintenance intervals in sectors like mining, cement, and power generation. Future developments include smart, sensor-integrated bearings and additive manufacturing to support a low-carbon economy and circularity.

title: Why 2026 could see momentum return to the steel technology transition
summary: After slower progress in recent years, the steel industry's shift away from fossil fuels is poised for renewed momentum in 2026 through advancing low-carbon technologies.

title: Future of Steel: Trends, Technology & Sustainability 2026
summary: The article examines upcoming trends in steel production by 2026, focusing on sustainability, scrap recycling, and emerging low-carbon technologies reshaping the industry.

title: Precious Metals Forecast (Feb 9, 2026): Gold Holds ...
summary: Copper has hit an all-time high of $14,527/ton, driven by cabling needs for AI data centers. The median forecast for 2026 is $11,975/ton, positioning it as a top-performing base metal. Nickel is stabilizing around $17,235/ton with support from Indonesian supply.

title: Copper Prices Are Tumbling, and a Larger Correction Could Be ...
summary: Copper prices hit a record above $14,000 per ton on Thursday but dropped to $13,800 on Friday amid broader metals sell-off. Goldman Sachs warns of a larger correction in Q2 2026 due to potential US tariffs on refined copper. Analysts note speculation over fundamentals, especially soft demand in China.

title: Copper Price Forecast – Market Outlook & Future Trends
summary: Copper trades around $6.03 per pound after rallying to over $13,000 per tonne recently. Forecasts for 2026 vary: World Bank at $9,800/tonne, Goldman Sachs at $11,400/tonne, J.P. Morgan near $12,075/tonne average amid supply tightness and demand from energy transition.

title: Why are oil and copper prices rising to record highs and will they ...
summary: Copper surged above $14,000 per ton driven by speculative buying in China and expectations of spending on power grids, data centers, and energy transition. A weak US dollar aided the rally, though physical demand in China is weak with high inventories. Analysts caution of potential correction if speculation fades.

title: Market Watch: Monday 9th February, 2026
summary: Explorer Cobre is reportedly closing in on a deal to buy a 25,000t-per-annum copper cathode operation in Chile. An associated $50 million raising at 15c per new share is also said to be in progress. This acquisition would expand Cobre's copper production capacity.

title: Abitibi Metals Delivers 124% Resource Growth at B26, Defining a High-Grade Copper-Gold System of Meaningful Scale
summary: Abitibi Metals reports a 124% increase in total mineral resources at the B26 deposit, expanding to 13.0 Mt Indicated at 2.1% CuEq and 12.3 Mt Inferred at 2.2% CuEq. The update is based on extensive drilling and reflects growth while maintaining grades. Mineralization remains open for further expansion.

title: Prospect boosts Mumbezhi copper resource
summary: Prospect Resources delivers a 63% tonnage increase and 50% rise in contained copper for the Mumbezhi Copper Project in Zambia, totaling 173.8 Mt at 0.44% Cu. Over 41% of the resource is now Indicated. The company plans extensive drilling in Q2 2026 to further expand resources.

title: Largo Reports Q4 and Full Year 2025 Operational and Sales Results; Provides 2026 Guidance
summary: Largo suspends ilmenite production guidance for 2026 due to promising copper/PGM production opportunities using existing infrastructure. Metallurgical flotation studies show potential for copper and PGM output. The company is conducting pilot tests to evaluate combined production economics.

title: Stuart Kimball Shares Insights on How Technology Is Transforming Arizona's Mining Industry
summary: The article explores how advanced technologies are reshaping Arizona's mining industry with a focus on safety, efficiency, and environmental stewardship. It highlights innovations like Florence Copper's in-situ copper recovery (ISCR), which produces 75% fewer carbon emissions and uses 65% less energy compared to traditional open-pit mining, and Resolution Copper's block cave mining technique that reduces environmental impact.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services has entered a strategic agreement with Rio Tinto to source low-carbon copper produced using Nuton bioleaching technology from Arizona's Johnson Camp mine. The Nuton system uses naturally occurring microorganisms to extract copper from primary sulphide ores, reducing water and emissions intensity while producing 99.99% pure copper cathode at the mine gate.

title: It All Comes Back to Supply Chains
summary: This article discusses how supply chain challenges for critical minerals are reshaping the technology industry, with AWS's early 2026 agreement with Rio Tinto to secure copper from Arizona representing the first new U.S.-mined copper supply in over a decade. The piece emphasizes that while this deal is strategically important, the projected 30,000 metric tons over several years represents only a fraction of copper needed for AI and electrification growth.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on February 9 as the central bank increased its gold holdings
summary: On February 9, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 133,900-145,000 yuan/mt, averaging 139,450 yuan/mt, up 3,650 yuan/mt from the previous day. The SHFE nickel contract (2603) closed the morning at 134,630 yuan/mt, up 1.53%, amid sluggish pre-holiday trading and a technical rebound. Spot demand remains weak, with focus post-holiday on Indonesia's nickel ore quota policy.

title: Goldman, Macquarie raise average nickel price forecasts for 2026 on tighter Indonesian supplies
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its 2026 nickel price forecast to $17,200 per ton from $14,800, citing Indonesia's reduced ore supply to 260 million wet tons. Prices could peak at $18,700 per ton in Q2 2026 before falling to $15,500 by year-end due to later supply increases. Macquarie lifted its LME nickel forecast to $17,750 per ton, projecting a smaller global surplus of 90,000 tonnes.

title: DMCI Mining eyes record 3-million WMT nickel output for 2026
summary: DMCI Mining targets 3 million WMT of nickel ore production in 2026 from mines in Zambales and Palawan, driven by higher prices enabling sales of lower-grade ore at $26 per WMT. The company saw 33% production growth to 2 million WMT in 2025, with shipments up 31% to 1.9 million WMT. Rising global nickel prices, boosted by Indonesia's capacity limits, support expansion plans.

title: SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review: Pre-Holiday Trading Remained Weak, Nickel Salt Prices Held Steady
summary: On February 9, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index was 31,646 yuan/mt, with quotes ranging 31,400-32,000 yuan/mt amid weak pre-holiday trading. Nickel salt prices remained steady despite sluggish market activity. This reflects ongoing trends in the nickel derivatives market tied to refined nickel movements.

title: DMCI Mining hits record nickel output as Zambales, Long Point ramp-up
summary: DMCI Mining achieved record 2 million WMT nickel ore production in 2025, up 33% year-on-year, with shipments at 1.9 million WMT, fueled by Zambales output and Long Point mine ramp-up. Philippine FOB laterite nickel ore prices for 1.5% grade rose 26% to $45.70, improving fundamentals. The company eyes further growth amid recovering nickel market and new capacity.

title: DMCI Mining eyes record 3-million WMT nickel output for 2026
summary: DMCI Mining Corp. plans to achieve a record-high 3 million wet metric tons (WMT) of nickel ore production in 2026 by operating three mine sites, including the pending Long Point mine in Palawan. The company reported a 33% increase in 2025 production to 2 million WMT, driven by Zambales operations. Favorable nickel prices, boosted by Indonesia's capacity limits, enable sales of lower-grade ore at attractive rates.

title: DMCI Mining says nickel output up 33% in 2025; Long Point mine set to start operations
summary: DMCI Mining Corp. achieved 33% higher nickel ore production at 2 million WMT in 2025, with shipments up 31% to 1.9 million WMT, fueled by Zambales mines and initial Long Point project in Palawan. The Long Point mine awaits final permits and could start within weeks, supporting a target of 3 million WMT shipments in 2026 amid strong prices. The company has rehabilitated areas at its Quezon mine ahead of schedule.

title: DMCI Mining hits record nickel output as Zambales, Long Point ramp-up
summary: DMCI Mining Corp. recorded 2 million WMT nickel ore production in 2025, a 33% rise from 2024, with shipments at 1.9 million WMT due to expanded Zambales operations and Long Point mine rollout. Nickel prices improved 26% year-on-year, enhancing market fundamentals. The company eyes growth from new capacity while advancing mine rehabilitation.

title: Canada Nickel: Betting on Western Supply Chains as Indonesia Reduces Production
summary: Canada Nickel's Crawford Project, the world's second-largest nickel reserve, targets construction start by end-2026 with $2.8B NPV and carbon-negative production amid Indonesia's output cuts. It offers large-scale nickel sulphide outside Indonesian/Chinese control, with 9.2 million tonnes indicated resources and expansion potential. Supply pressures in Western battery chains highlight its strategic value.

title: Canada Nickel Announces US$32 Million Bridge Loan Facility with Auramet International Inc.
summary: Canada Nickel secured a US$32 million bridge loan from Auramet, closing by February 9, 2026, to fund its Crawford Nickel Sulphide Project, due May 2026 with 1% monthly interest. The project features robust economics from a prior PEA, including a 120,000 tonnes/day plant for nickel and magnetite concentrates. This supports advancement amid strong nickel demand.

title: Green nickel for sustainable electrification: Carbon-free process extracts nickel for batteries and steel
summary: Researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Sustainable Materials have developed a carbon-free, energy-saving method for nickel extraction using hydrogen plasma, enabling use of low-grade ores. This single-step process reduces CO2 emissions significantly and supports sustainable production for batteries and stainless steel. The findings are published in Nature, with plans to scale for industrial use.

title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
summary: The article discusses strategies to manage surging nickel demand for EV batteries, including adopting LFP and sodium-ion batteries to reduce reliance by up to 33% by 2030. It emphasizes material innovation, battery recycling, and smaller batteries for a sustainable supply chain. Alaska Energy Metals Corporation is highlighted for sustainable nickel sourcing in the US.

title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
summary: Demand for critical minerals like nickel for clean energy technologies is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040. The mining industry must innovate responsibly, collaborating with governments and communities to balance environmental stewardship and economic growth. Trust in sustainable practices will be key for net-zero goals by 2050.

title: Clean energy supply chains of the future need a circular economy
summary: Post-COP30, a circular economy for critical minerals like nickel can reduce emissions by 80% through recycling compared to mining. This strengthens supply chain resilience amid concentrated production and supports global energy transition goals. Discussions at the 2026 Annual Meeting will focus on environmental protection and growth.

title: Sustainable Approaches to Zinc Nickel on Electrical Vehicles
summary: Zinc-nickel alloy plating is increasingly used for EV battery housing due to its corrosion resistance and sustainability benefits. Rack alkaline zinc-nickel processes with high-efficiency options are promoted for eco-friendly finishing. The paper originates from SUR/FIN 2025.

title: Prysmian to Acquire Submarine Cable Survey and Installation Company ACSM for €169 Million
summary: Prysmian announced the acquisition of Spanish specialist ACSM for €169 million (approximately $200 million USD) on an all-cash basis. The transaction, expected to close by February 2026, will strengthen Prysmian's position as a fully integrated provider in the subsea cable market by bringing submarine cable surveying, seabed preparation, and installation solutions in-house.

title: Prysmian Group & Fincantieri Acquire Subsea Cable Provider Xtera
summary: Italian cable maker Prysmian and shipbuilder Fincantieri jointly acquired subsea telecom cable provider Xtera for approximately $65 million. This acquisition complements Prysmian's broader strategy to expand its presence in the subsea cable sector.

title: Prysmian Signs €2.3 Billion Contract for UK Power Link Project
summary: Italian cable maker Prysmian signed a contract worth over €2.3 billion with SP Energy Networks and National Grid to build the Eastern Green Link 4 power transmission link connecting the electrical grids of Scotland and England.

title: World's Top Cable Maker Sees US Copper Tariff as Opportunity
summary: Prysmian, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire for $4 billion, expressed support for President Trump's planned 50% copper tariff, stating it will bolster the American supply chain. The company believes its vertical integration and domestic copper sourcing position it favorably relative to competitors.

title: Prysmian, Versalis Launch Chemical Recycling Chain for Plastic Cable Waste in Italy
summary: Prysmian and Versalis established a strategic partnership for chemical recycling of end-of-life and production cable plastics in Italy. Using Versalis's Hoop® technology, the initiative will recover up to 60% of difficult-to-recycle XLPE insulation, with pilot operations scheduled to begin in the second half of 2026.
